node.description: This module contains counters and control registers of all the optical links on the board (regardless of link rate or what they connect to)

MGT channel ${MGT} control and status. Note: these are MGT channles, which do not correspond 1-to-1 with the fiber numbering. Please refer here for MGT channel to fiber mapping: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-AE7GeeU10GfLB-9FYOMN4k0-Z7bVkiQpLfXC4G2irI
Writing 1 to bit 0 will trigger MGT TX channel reset, and writing 1 to bit 1 will trigger the MGT RX channel reset (write 3 to trigger both)
Writing 1 to this reg will trigger MGT TX channel reset
Writing 1 to this reg will trigger MGT RX channel reset
Writing 1 to this reg will trigger MGT CPLL reset
Writing 1 to this reg will trigger the QPLL reset of the whole quad

This register exposes multiple MGT controls: bit 0 -- TX powerdown, bit 1 -- RX powerdown, bit 2 -- TX polarity, bit 3 -- RX polarity, bit 4 -- loopback, bit 5 -- TX inhibit, bit 6 -- RX low power mode enable
Setting this to 1 will powerdown the TX (writes 11 to TXPD), and 0 will put it in normal power mode (writes 00 to TXPD)
Setting this to 1 will powerdown the RX (writes 11 to RXPD), and 0 will put it in normal power mode (writes 00 to RXPD)
Setting this to 1 will invert the polarity of TX, setting to 0 will result in normal TX polarity
Setting this to 1 will invert the polarity of RX, setting to 0 will result in normal RX polarity
Setting this to 1 will enable the near-end PMA loopback of the MGT (sets MGT LOOPBACK port to 010). This is an expert debug feature.
Setting this to 1 will inhibit the TX channel (forces MGTHTXP to 0 and MGTHTXN to 1). This is an expert debug feature.
Setting this to 1 enables the RX LPM (this controls RXLPMEN). NOTE: THIS MUST ALWAYS BE SET TO 1 FOR GOOD RX PERFORMANCE WITH 8b10b ENCODING.
Controls the RX PRBS mode: 000 -- normal operation (no PRBS checks), 001 -- PRBS7, 010 -- PRBS15, 011 -- PRBS23, 100 -- PRBS31

Controls the TX PRBS mode: 000 -- normal operation (no PRBS), 001 -- PRBS7, 010 -- PRBS15, 011 -- PRBS23, 100 -- PRBS31, 101 -- PCIe compliance patteren, 110 -- square wave with 2 UI (alternating 0s and 1s), 111 -- square wave with 16 UI, 20 UI, 32 UI or 40 UI period depending on data width
Writing 1 here resets the PRBS error counters
Writing 1 here resets the RX error counters for this channel (not in table and disperr)
TX reset done signal
RX reset done signal
CPLL locked signal
CPLL reference clock is lost if this is 1
PRBS error counter
PRBS error counter
RX not-in-table counter
RX disparity error counter
